channel.title: Nirvana vs Alice In Chains
channel.description:
don't get me wrong nirvana is okay but - they're generic - they're overrated - the vocals are mediocre at best - simple easy to write lyrics - simple easy to write instrumentals (very punk influenced)
alice in chains - not generic - underrated - amazing vocals, lots of harmonies with the guitar player - poetic lyrics - more complex instrumentals (very metal influenced)
gotta give it to alice in chains. thoughts on my opinion? what band do you favor more and why?
if you haven't heard either:
aic [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZLUj-jh_UyQ[/youtube]
nirvana [youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R0AqE9dapV0[/youtube]

item.title: Nirvana vs Alice In Chains
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

I love grunge, so right away I like both AIC and Nirvana. Cobain’s vocals aren’t mediocre in the least. As for the lyrics, a lot of their songs are controversial and have a lot deeper meaning than what people think. You really have to put yourself in Cobain’s place in order to truly understand what the songs mean, because he wrote a lot of songs based on what was happening in his life or his personal opinions on things. ‘Rape me’ is a great example of this. People really dislike that song because they think it’s saying raping is OK, but in reality, Cobain was anti-rape and the song reflects that if you understand it.

Read full topic

item.title: Nirvana vs Alice In Chains
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

don’t get me wrong nirvana is okay but

  • they’re generic
  • they’re overrated
  • the vocals are mediocre at best
  • simple easy to write lyrics
  • simple easy to write instrumentals (very punk influenced)

alice in chains

  • not generic
  • underrated
  • amazing vocals, lots of harmonies with the guitar player
  • poetic lyrics
  • more complex instrumentals (very metal influenced)

gotta give it to alice in chains. thoughts on my opinion? what band do you favor more and why?
